title: PowerShell CLI Documentation Updates
details:
Updated all CLI examples in the documentation to use PowerShell syntax for Windows:

Key changes made:
1. Changed all `bash` code blocks to `powershell`
2. Updated executable references from `na.exe` to `.\na.exe` (relative path syntax)
3. Updated shell commands from Unix-style to PowerShell equivalents
4. Maintained all CLI flags and arguments unchanged

Files updated:
- docs/index.md: Updated build commands and basic CLI example
- docs/getting-started/index.md: Updated basic usage examples
- docs/getting-started/installation.md: Updated verification and config examples  
- docs/getting-started/basic-commands.md: Comprehensive update of all CLI examples
- docs/getting-started/faq.md: Updated examples and troubleshooting commands
- docs/user-guide/index.md: Updated use case examples
- docs/user-guide/file-processing.md: Updated all processing examples and options

PowerShell conventions used:
- `.\na.exe` for executable in current directory
- PowerShell-style paths and commands
- Retained all existing CLI flags and parameters
- Updated date formatting example to use PowerShell Get-Date syntax

All CLI examples now assume Windows PowerShell environment as requested.
